name: European Telecommunications Standards Institute
legal: Not for profit association (French Law 1 July 1901)
goal: ETSI produces global standards for Information and Communications Technologies (ICT), including fixed, mobile, radio, converged, broadcast and Internet technologies.
interests: Banking and financial services, Business and Industry, Competition, Consumers, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Education and training, Energy, Environment, External Relations, Foreign affairs and security policy, Institutional affairs, International co-operation and development, Public Health, Research and innovation, Single market, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives:
EU policy on European Standardization as defined in EU Regulation 1025/2012.

ETSI is one of the 3 standards organizations recognized by EU. It is funded at 80% by members and partners contribution and receives funding from the European Commission.
ETSI is specifically active in the scope of the ICT-RP (Rolling Plan) as well as in specific areas such as the RED (Radio equipment Directive), cybersecurity, mobile payments, IoT, interoperability.

ETSI works closely with the European Commission (standards in support of policy/legislation and regulation)
ETSI has interaction with policy makers (EC/EP/Council) on all those files.
